Submodules¶

multipy.core.algorithm module¶

class multipy.core.algorithm.Algorithm(matrix: Matrix)[source]¶

Bases: Matrix

A given algorithm is created on top of a zero initialised Logical AND matrix. The first operation in the algorithm must populate this matrix with partial products.

populate(arg: Any) → None[source]¶

Adds template(s) to an existing algorithm. All templates must be of consistent bitwidth.

classmethod step(matrix: Matrix) → None[source]¶

Take youngest template, apply to matrix, remove template

classmethod trim(matrix: Matrix) → None[source]¶

Trim empty rows from a matrix

multipy.core.map module¶

multipy.core.map.build_map() → list[list[int]][source]¶

A map matrix holds signed hexadecimal numbers representing a vertical offset for a given bit when applied to an algorithm.

[map] [matrix] [effect]

00 02 01 _ 0 1 _ 1 _

00 FF 00 0 1 _ 0 _ 1

00 00 00 _ _ _ _ 0 _

multipy.core.map.build_simple_map()[source]¶
multipy.core.map.dadda_map()[source]¶

Return map to collect partial products into an upside down triangle: a prerequisite for the dadda algorithm.

multipy.core.matrix module¶

class multipy.core.matrix.Matrix(bits: int)[source]¶

Bases: object

classmethod build_matrix(operand_a: int, operand_b: int, bits: int)[source]¶

Build Logical AND matrix using source operands.

classmethod pretty(matrix: list[list[Any]]) → str[source]¶

Format self.matrix as a string:

“____0000

___0000_

__0000__

_0000___”

multipy.core.template module¶

class multipy.core.template.Template(template: list[Any], result: Any = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

merge(templates: list[Any]) → None[source]¶

Merge multiple templates into a single template.

multipy.core.template.build_adder(char: str, template_slice: list[list[Any]]) → tuple[list, list][source]¶

Returns template “slices” for addition and the resulting slice.

[slice ] [adder] [result]

___0000_ ___aAaA_

__0000__ __AaAa__ _aAaAaA_

multipy.core.template.build_csa(char: str, template_slice: list[list[Any]]) → tuple[list, list][source]¶

Returns template “slices” for a csa reduction and the resulting slice.

[slice] [csa] [result]

____0000 ____AaAa

___0000_ ___aAaA_ __AaAaAa

__0000__ __AaAa__ __aAaA__

multipy.core.template.build_simple_template(pattern: list[str]) → list[list[str]][source]¶

Build a simple template for a given bitwidth. >>> self.bits = 4 >>> build_template(self.pattern)

[[‘_’,’_’,’_’,’_’,’A’,’a’,’A’,’a’], # p = [‘a’,

[‘_’,’_’,’_’,’A’,’a’,’A’,’a’,’_’], # ‘a’,

[‘_’,’_’,’B’,’b’,’B’,’b’,’_’,’_’], # ‘b’,

[‘_’,’B’,’b’,’B’,’b’,’_’,’_’,’_’]] # ‘b’]

multipy.core.truth module¶

multipy.core.truth.shallow_truth_table(scope: Generator, alg: Algorithm) → Generator[source]¶
multipy.core.truth.truth_scope(domain_: tuple[int, int], range_: tuple[int, int]) → Generator[source]¶

A generator based on the domain and range of a desired truth table. >>> domain = (min_in, max_in) >>> range = (min_out, max_out) Yields: (operand_a, operand_b)

multipy.core.truth.truth_table(scope: Generator, alg: Algorithm) → Generator[source]¶

A generator which yields all stages of an algorithm for a given set of operands a, b.
